Detailed Description

This class provides min filter functionality for DImage objects.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DMinFilter::DMinFiltType
Enumerator:
DMinFilt_slow 

Slow method.

DMinFilt_circle 

Histogram (based on Huang) method, circular kernel.

DMinFilt_square 

Histogram (based on Huang) method, square kernel.

void DMinFilter::setNumThreads ( int  numThreads)

Set the number of threads that will be used to do the min filter.

The min filter may run faster if more than one thread is used, especially if the machine has more than one processor. With numThreads threads specified, thread 0 will start with y=0, thread 1 with y=1, and so on, and each will skip numThreads rows between each row that it operates on. Only thread 0 will report status. Note: our experiments show that using multiple threads does not seem to speed up the min filter very much. For example, on a very large image with radius=35, we saw a speedup from 33.6 seconds to 29.1 seconds with 2 threads, and to 28.7 sec with 4 threads. When the code is not optimized, there is a more noticible speedup, but we assume you will optimize your code.

void DMinFilter::setRadius ( int  radiusX,
int  radiusY 
)

Set the kernel (window) radii for the min filter.

The actual width (and height) of the window will be 2*radius+1

References radiusX, and radiusY.

void DMinFilter::setType ( DMinFiltType  filtType)

set the type of min filter algorithm

By default, RGB and _u8 images will use Huang_circle and all others (including RGB_16 and _u16) will use the slow method
